#summary How to build the SamlBeans project

SamlBeans uses Maven 2 to build.  

The project's root pom.xml inherits from a parent pom hierarchy that handles a _lot_ of the boilerplate in setting up a clean maven from scratch - ensuring the correct java compiler plugin is used, that the project uses UTF-8 encoding by default, and much more.

That parent pom hierarchy is not currently in Maven Central, so you'll need to add a repository to your local $HOME/.m2/settings.xml file.  After you add the following, you'll be able to build on the command line as expected.

{{{
<!-- If you have an existing profiles section, add to it.  If not, create it: -->
<profiles>
    <profile>
        <id>katasoft</id>
        <repositories>
            <repository>
                <id>katasoft-releases</id>
                <name>Katasoft Artifact Repository: Releases</name>
                <url>http://repository.katasoft.com/content/groups/public</url>
                <layout>default</layout>
                <releases>
                    <enabled>true</enabled>
                </releases>
                <snapshots>
                    <enabled>false</enabled>
                </snapshots>
            </repository>
            <repository>
                <id>katasoft-snapshots</id>
                <name>Katasoft Artifact Repository: Snapshots</name>
                <url>http://repository.katasoft.com/content/groups/public-snapshots</url>
                <layout>default</layout>
                <releases>
                    <enabled>false</enabled>
                </releases>
                <snapshots>
                    <enabled>true</enabled>
                </snapshots>
            </repository>
        </repositories>
    </profile>
</profiles>

<activeProfiles>
    <!-- Any other profiles you may have -->
    <activeProfile>katasoft</activeProfile>
</activeProfiles>
}}}
